conclusion: To calculate distance, analyze acceleration-time graph to determine velocity and position.
Graph shows acceleration changes: 0-30s at 2 m/s², 30-60s at -1 m/s².
Velocity is found by integrating acceleration over time.
Interval 1: Velocity from 0 to 30s is v(t) = 2t, v(30) = 60 m/s.
Interval 2: Velocity from 30 to 60s is v(t) = 90 - t.
Position is found by integrating velocity over time.
Interval 1: Position from 0 to 30s is x(t) = t², x(30) = 900 m.
Interval 2: Position from 30 to 60s is x(t) = 90t - t²/2 - 1350.
Final answer: Distance traveled is 2250 m.
